title: Problem Statement and Background
content: Erdős Problem #1045: Maximize ∏|zᵢ-zⱼ| for n complex points with diameter ≤ 2. Regular polygon NOT optimal for even n ≥ 4, but may be optimal for odd n (open).

title: Configuration
content: A Configuration of n points is a function Fin n → ℂ, assigning a complex number to each index.

title: Diameter Constraint
content: DiameterAtMost2 means all pairwise distances |zᵢ - zⱼ| ≤ 2. This bounds the 'spread' of the configuration.

title: Product of Distances Δ
content: Delta(z₁,...,zₙ) = ∏_{i≠j} |zᵢ-zⱼ|. The product is over all ORDERED pairs, so each distance appears twice.

title: Regular Polygon
content: The n-th roots of unity form a regular polygon on the unit circle. Scaling gives diameter 2.

title: Δ for Even n
content: For a regular n-gon with even n, Δ = n^n. This is a classical result from the theory of cyclotomic polynomials.

title: Δ for Odd n
content: For odd n, Δ = cos(π/2n)^{-n(n-1)} · n^n, which asymptotically equals e^{π²/8} · n^n. The odd case has a factor > 1.

title: Polynomial from Roots
content: polynomialFromRoots constructs the monic polynomial f(w) = ∏(w - zᵢ). The product of pairwise distances equals |Δf'(z)|^{1/2}.

title: Erdős-Herzog-Piranian (1958)
content: If the sublevel set {w : |f(w)| < 1} is connected and f is monic with roots zᵢ, then Δ < n^n. This connects to potential theory.

title: Pommerenke's Upper Bound (1961)
content: For any configuration with diameter ≤ 2, Δ ≤ 2^{O(n)} · n^n. This shows max Δ is at most exponentially larger than the regular polygon value.

title: Hu-Tang Counterexample n=4
content: Hu and Tang found an explicit 4-point configuration beating the square. This was the first counterexample to the regular polygon conjecture.

title: Hu-Tang Counterexample n=6
content: Similar counterexample for n=6. The regular hexagon is not optimal.

title: Cambie: All Even n ≥ 4
content: Cambie generalized the counterexamples: regular polygon is NOT optimal for ANY even n ≥ 4. This resolves the even case completely.

title: Maximum Δ
content: MaxDelta(n) = sup{Δ(z) : DiameterAtMost2(z)}. The maximum product over all valid configurations.

title: Sothanaphan (2025)
content: liminf(max Δ / n^n) ≥ 1.0378 for even n. This quantifies how much better optimal configurations are than regular polygons.

title: Cambie-Dong-Tang: 6|n
content: When 6 divides n, the lower bound improves to C ≈ 1.304. Special structure is exploited.

title: Cambie-Dong-Tang: All Even n
content: For all even n, liminf(max Δ / n^n) ≥ 1.269. The current best lower bound.

title: Odd Conjecture
content: Conjecture: The regular polygon IS optimal for odd n. No counterexamples are known for odd n.

title: Odd Case Open
content: Whether regular polygon is optimal for odd n remains unresolved. Neither proved nor disproved.

title: Optimal for n=2
content: For n=2, the maximum Δ = 4 is achieved by any two points at distance 2. This is trivially optimal.

title: Regular Optimal for n=3
content: The equilateral triangle is optimal for n=3. This is an odd case where the conjecture holds.

title: Main Problem Statement
content: Combines: (1) Pommerenke's upper bound, (2) regular polygon not optimal for even n ≥ 4, (3) lower bounds exceeding n^n for even n.

title: Summary Theorem
content: Summary: Even n resolved (regular NOT optimal, max Δ / n^n ≥ 1.269). Odd n remains open.
